verses.1: The wise woman builds her house, but with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down.
verses.2: He whose walk is upright fears the LORD, but he whose ways are devious despises him.
verses.3: A fool's talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.
verses.4: Where there are no oxen, the manger is empty, but from the strength of an ox comes an abundant harvest.
verses.5: A truthful witness does not deceive, but a false witness pours out lies.
verses.6: The mocker seeks wisdom and finds none, but knowledge comes easily to the discerning.
verses.7: Stay away from a foolish man, for you will not find knowledge on his lips.
verses.8: The wisdom of the prudent is to give thought to their ways, but the folly of fools is deception.
verses.9: Fools mock at making amends for sin, but goodwill is found among the upright.
verses.10: Each heart knows its own bitterness, and no one else can share its joy.
verses.11: The house of the wicked will be destroyed, but the tent of the upright will flourish.
verses.12: There is a way that seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.
verses.13: Even in laughter the heart may ache, and joy may end in grief.
verses.14: The faithless will be fully repaid for their ways, and the good man rewarded for his.
verses.15: A simple man believes anything, but a prudent man gives thought to his steps.
verses.17: A quick-tempered man does foolish things, and a crafty man is hated.
verses.16: A wise man fears the LORD and shuns evil, but a fool is hotheaded and reckless.
verses.19: Evil men will bow down in the presence of the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.18: The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.21: He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who is kind to the needy.
verses.20: The poor are shunned even by their neighbors, but the rich have many friends.
verses.23: All hard work brings a profit, but mere talk leads only to poverty.
verses.22: Do not those who plot evil go astray? But those who plan what is good find love and faithfulness.
verses.25: A truthful witness saves lives, but a false witness is deceitful.
verses.24: The wealth of the wise is their crown, but the folly of fools yields folly.
verses.27: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, turning a man from the snares of death.
verses.26: He who fears the LORD has a secure fortress, and for his children it will be a refuge.
verses.29: A patient man has great understanding, but a quick-tempered man displays folly.
verses.28: A large population is a king's glory, but without subjects a prince is ruined.
verses.31: He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for their Maker, but whoever is kind to the needy honors God.
verses.30: A heart at peace gives life to the body, but envy rots the bones.
verses.34: Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
verses.35: A king delights in a wise servant, but a shameful servant incurs his wrath.
verses.32: When calamity comes, the wicked are brought down, but even in death the righteous have a refuge.
verses.33: Wisdom reposes in the heart of the discerning and even among fools she lets herself be known.
